Astronomy is the study of celestial objects and phenomena that originate outside Earth's atmosphere. This includes stars, galaxies, planets, and other celestial bodies. It also examines the properties, interactions, and evolution of these objects and phenomena. Astronomers use various techniques, such as observation, mathematics, physics, and chemistry, to understand the universe and its behavior. They study the universe's origin, its age, and its ultimate fate. Additionally, they explore the possibility of life elsewhere in the universe. This vast and fascinating field continues to expand our knowledge and understanding of the cosmos.

Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects and phenomena that originate outside Earth's atmosphere. This includes stars, planets, galaxies, and more. It explores their properties, origins, and evolution. Astronomy uses mathematics, physics, and chemistry to understand the universe. It also involves observations from telescopes and spacecraft. This helps us learn about the cosmos, our solar system, and even the possibility of life elsewhere. Astronomy fuels our curiosity about the unknown and inspires us to keep discovering.

Astronomy is the scientific exploration of the universe, focusing on celestial objects such as stars, planets, and galaxies. It involves the study of their properties, interactions, and evolution over time. Astronomers, scientists who specialize in this field, use powerful telescopes to observe and collect data from space. By analyzing this information, they can uncover the mysteries of the universe and make discoveries that advance our understanding of its origins and complexities.
